channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Boulanger régale les gamers avec cet écran Samsung QHD de 27″ et 350 Hz bradé à un super prix
item.description: L'écran PC Samsung Odyssey G6 G60F est affiché à 399,99 euros au lieu de 499,99 euros sur Boulanger, de quoi s'équiper avec du matériel de qualité pour jouer dans de bonnes conditions.

item.title: Want to know which 2025 LG OLED TV to buy? I tested three models side-by-side, and there's one clear winner
item.description: I evaluated the G5, C5 and B5 side-by-side to find out which is the best overall value.

item.title: ‘The Batman Part II’ May Have Scarlett Johansson For a Killer Role
item.description: Johansson may wind up playing someone most people wouldn't have guessed (or known) for 'The Batman Part II.'

item.title: Inside the high drama of the iPhone 4
item.description: By 2010, the iPhone era was in full swing. Smartphones were still a new and unfinished idea - the iPhone had only just gotten copy and paste! - but it was clear that these big slabs of glass were going to change the way we did pretty much everything. Apple was also already on an […]

item.title: On a essayé l’Opel Mokka GSe : une voiture électrique pensée comme une essence performante
item.description: On a toujours tendance à opposer voiture électrique et thermique. Mais si l’on décidait de prendre la recette d'une petite GTI pour l'appliquer à une voiture électrique, quel serait le résultat ? Opel l'a tenté avec son Mokka GSe, que nous avons pu essayer sur route et sur circuit !

item.title: Best Tested Walking Pads (2025): Urevo, WalkingPad, Sperax
item.description: These compact walking pads fit under your desk and make staying active so much easier.

item.title: I tested Ring’s new outdoor camera in my garden and was blown away by the picture quality (and high price tag)
item.description: The Ring Outdoor Cam Pro's 4K resolution and 10x magnification with pinch-to-zoom give you a better view than ever

item.title: Inside the AI-powered assault on SaaS: why identity is the weakest link
item.description: Your SaaS security isn’t failing at the perimeter—AI-powered identity breaches are bypassing it entirely.

item.description: Whether you’re going off-grid or safeguarding against blackouts, these beefy, WIRED-tested batteries can keep the lights on.

item.title: The end of OpenAI, and other 2026 predictions
item.description: Here's a thought: what if the next-generation Siri is awesome? Not just awesome for setting timers and dictating text messages (though that would be nice), but so awesome and fun to talk to that people actually start falling in love with their iPhones. We may not be prepared for what happens next. On this episode […]
